summary: pathogenic studies focusing on hand, foot and mouth disease have shown that enterovirus 71 (EV71) is one of the major pathogens responsible for human cases of HFMD. multiple clinical and pathological studies focusing on the fatal cases of HFMD suggest that the brainstem encephalitis caused by EV71 infection of the central nervous system (CNS) and subsequent neurogenic heart and lung failure ultimately contribute to the severe pathogenesis in these human patients. the pathogenic process did not result in severe neurogenic heart failure or pulmonary edema. however, there was remarkable alveolar inflammatory effusion and partial destruction of the alveolar wall, among other pathological changes. microaary analysis can harness the systematic gene expression profile and its
